snippet: “An Alpine Symphony,” Richard Strauss’s ode to a mountainous ascent, is rarely performed because of the claims it makes on an orchestra. But on Wednesday evening two companies on two different New York stages will play it.
abstract: European Union Youth Orchestra and Julliard Orchestra are to stage two separate performances of Richard Strauss's An Alpine Symphony, at Carnegie Hall and Avery Fischer Hall respectively; symphony is the last of Strauss's tone poems, rarely performed because of claims it makes on an orchestra.
lead_paragraph: “An Alpine Symphony,” Richard Strauss’s ode to a mountainous ascent, is rarely performed because of the claims it makes on an orchestra. But on Wednesday evening two companies on two different New York stages will play it.

headline.seo: Strauss’s ‘Alpine Symphony’ Played Twice in One Night
headline.main: A Walk Up the Wild Side of the Alps
headline.print_headline: A Walk Up The Wild Side Of the Alps
